data.title: Physical Education Sports MCQs For Competitive Exam
data.meta_description: Enjoy which is the national sport of canada? hockey cricket field hockey volleyball view answer hide answer answer: hockey archery is the national sport of
data.text:
Which is the national sport of Canada?

a. Lacrosse/Ice hockey b. Cricket c. Field hockey d. Volleyball

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: a. Lacrosse/Ice hockey

Archery is the national sport of which country?

a. Afghanistan b. Bhutan c. Japan d. India

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: b. Bhutan

____________ has Cricket as its national sports.

a. India b. Jamaica c. Sri Lanka d. United States

View Answer / Hide Answer

_____________ is the national sport of Turkey

a. Wrestling b. Rugby union c. Golf d. Basketball

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: a. Wrestling

When was the Commonwealth game started?

a. 1930 b. 1934 c. 1938 d. 1950

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: a. 1930

Which was the host country in 1998 for Asian Games?

a. Thailand b. Philippines c. South Korea d. China

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: a. Thailand

Which city has hosted Asian Games in 2006?

a. Doha b. Bangkok c. New Delhi d. Tokyo

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: a. Doha

In which country commonwealth games were held in 2010?

a. India b. Canada c. Malaysia d. Australia

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: a. India

Which city hosted commonwealth games in 1966?

a. Kingston b. Perth c. Melbourne d. Kuala Lumpur

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: a. Kingston

____________ has won Cricket world cup for the maximum number of times.

a. Australia b. India c. West Indies d. Sri Lanka

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: a. Australia

Football World Cup has been won by which country for the maximum number of times?

a. Italy b. Uruguay c. West Germany d. Brazil

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: d. Brazil

Which country has hosted Commonwealth Games for the maximum number of times?

a. Canada b. New Zealand c. England d. Scotland

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: a. Canada

In which year Asian Games were started?

a. 1951 b. 1954 c. 1958 d. 1962

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: a. 1951

First Olympic Games was held in

Which term is commonly used in Badminton and Volleyball?

a. Deuce b. Dribble c. Double d. Dummy

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: a. Deuce

___________ is used in Boxing.

a. Upper Cut b. Mallet c. Bunder Chuckker d. Deuce

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: a. Upper Cut

If we are using the following words in a game. Which game are we playing?

Break, Cannons, Cue, In off, Jigger, Scratch

a. Billiards b. Bridge c. Polo d. Baseball

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: a. Billiards

In which year Football World Cup was held in France?

a. 1998 b. 1950 c. 1962 d. 1990

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: a. 1998

Who was the winner of Football World Cup in 2010?

a. Spain b. Italy c. Brazil d. France

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: a. Spain

Olympic Games were first started by which country and in which year?

a. Greece (1896) b. France (1924) c. Greece (1890) d. France (1894)

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: a. Greece (1896)

How many nations participated in 2012 Olympic Games?

a. 204

b. 197 c. 199 d. 121

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: a. 204

In __________ Olympic Games were held in Spain.

a. 1992 b. 1948 c. 1968 d. 1980

View Answer / Hide Answer

Which city of United States hosted Olympic Games in 1996?

a. Atlanta b. St. Louis c. Los Angeles d. None of the above

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: a. Atlanta

In 2012 which country hosted Olympic Games?

a. United Kingdom b. China c. Greece d. Australia

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: a. United Kingdom

Which one of the following does not belong to the national styles of Kabaddi?

a) Amar b) Gamini c) Sanjeevani d) Goongi

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: d) Goongi

Sanjeevani, Gamini and Amar are the three national styles recognized by the International Kabaddi Federation.

Where did the game of Badminton originate?

a) Delhi b) Pune c) Karachi d) Tamil Nadu

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: b) Pune

Badminton has been an Olympic sport since 1992.

Who was the first person to win the Grand Slam in tennis?

a) Bill Tilden b) Don Budge c) Henry Vines d) Jack Kramer

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER:

Deuce is a situation in which both opposing players have won three points.

Which of the following terms is not used in the game of Lawn Tennis?

a) Ace b) Back hand drive c) Gambit d) Smash

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: c) Gambit

A gambit is a chess opening in which a player, more often White, sacrifices material, usually a pawn, with the hope of achieving a resulting advantageous position.

Which of the following is related to Jallikattu sport played in Tamil Nadu and neighbouring states of India?

a) Bullfight and bullock-cart racing b) Cockfight c) Dogfight d) Cricket fight

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: a) Bullfight and bullock-cart racing

Jallikattu is a bull taming sport played in Tamil Nadu as a part of Pongal celebrations on Mattu Pongal day.

Who among the following has won the women's singles title of the WTA Finals?

a) Helen Wills Moody

b) Margaret Court c) Serena Williams d) Steffi Graf

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: c) Serena Williams

The Women's Tennis Association (WTA) has ranked her World No. 1 in singles on six separate occasions.

Which of the following awards is given for excellence in sports coaching in India?

a) Arjuna Awards b) Dronacharya Award c) Dhyan Chand Award d) Rajiv Gandhi Khel Ratna

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: b) Dronacharya Award

The Indian Government instituted Dronacharya Award in 1985.

When is national sports day of India celebrated?

a) April 6 b) August 29 c) September 14 d) October 11

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: b) August 29

The Government of India has declared 29th August as Sports Day in honour of Major Dhyan Chand.

Which one of the following is associated with Gagan Narang?

a) Air rifle shooting b) Athletics c) Badminton d) Golf

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: a) Air rifle shooting

He was the first Indian to qualify for the London Olympics.

Who was the oldest male player to win the French Open?

a) Andre Gobert b) Andre Vacherot c) Henri Cochet d) Max Decugis

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: b) Andre Vacherot

Andre Vacherot was a French male tennis player. He is best remembered for having won the French Championships on 1894, 1895, 1896, and 1901.

Who was the oldest female player to win the French Open?

a) Jan Lehane b) Andrea Temesvari c) Nelly Landry d) Zsuzsa Kormoczy

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: d) Zsuzsa Kormoczy

Zsuzsa Kormoczy was a female tennis player from Hungary. She won the singles title at the 1958 French Championships at the age of 33

When did the first Wimbledon Tennis championship take place?

a) 1875 b) 1877 c) 1880 d) 1884

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: b) 1877

Worple Road in Wimbledon hosted the first World Tennis Championship.

Who was the first winner of Wimbledon Tennis Championships?

a) Arthur Gore b) Ernest Renshaw c) Frank Hadow d) Spencer Gore

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: d) Spencer Gore

Spencer Gore was the Father of the Volley.

When was overhead smash introduced?

a) 1875 b) 1877 c) 1880 d) 1884

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: c) 1880

In 1905 she became the first American player to win the singles title at Wimbledon.

Who became the first international Wimbledon Mens Singles Champion?

a) Arthur Gore b) Laurence Doherty c) Norman Brookes d) Reginald Doherty

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: c) Norman Brookes

Norman Brookes of Australia was the first left-hander to win the men's singles title at Wimbledon in 1907.

Who became the oldest Wimbledon Ladies Singles champion?

a) Blanche Bingley b) Charlotte Sterry c) Dorothy Cheney d) Maud Watson

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: b) Charlotte Sterry

At the age of 37 years, Charlotte Sterry of United KIngdom became the oldest Wimbledon Ladies Singles champion in 1908

Who became the oldest Wimbledon Mens Singles champion?

a) Arthur Gore b) Ernest Renshaw c) Laurence Doherty d) Reginald Doherty

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: a) Arthur Gore

At the age of 41 years, Arthur Gore of Great Britain became the oldest Wimbledon Mens Singles champion in 1909.

Who became the first player to win triple crown of Ladies Singles, Ladies Doubles and Mixed Doubles?

a) Helen Jacobs b) Helen Wills c) Louise Brough d) Suzanne Lenglen

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: d) Suzanne Lenglen

Suzanne Rachel Flore Lenglen was a French tennis player who won 31 Championship titles between 1914 and 1926.

When was the Tie-break introduced?

a) 1962 b) 1967 c) 1971 d) 1973

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: c) 1971

It came into effect if the score in games achieved 8-8 in any set except the final set.

When did Bjorn Borg win his first singles title?

a) 1971 b) 1973 c) 1975 d) 1976

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: d) 1976

Borg was the first player to earn more than one million dollars in prize money in a single season, in 1979.

When was Wimbledon Lawn Tennis Museum opened?

a) 1977 b) 1979 c) 1980 d) 1985

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: a) 1977

Wimbledon Lawn Tennis Museum is the largest tennis museum in the world.

Who won the men's singles title at Wimbledon as a wildcard?

a) Goran Ivansevic b) Fabrice Santoro c) Marin Cilic d) Mark Philippoussis

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: a) Goran Ivansevic

In 2001, Goran Ivansevic of Croatia won the men's singles title at Wimbledon as a wildcard.

When was International Olympic Committee founded?

a) 1854 b) 1874 c) 1894 d) 1898

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: c) 1894

Demetrios Vikelas was its first president.

The Ancient Olympics took place in honour of which Greek God?

a) Apollo b) Athena c) Herculus d) Zeus

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: d) Zeus

The first Olympics is traditionally dated to 776 BC.

When were gold, silver, bronze medals at Olympics introduced?

a) 1896 b) 1900 c) 1904 d) 1916

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: c) 1904

The custom of the sequence of gold, silver and bronze for the first three places dates

Who is the first Indian woman to win an Asian Games gold in 400m run?

a) Kamaljeet Sandhu b) K c) M. D. Valsamma d) P. T. Usha

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: a) Kamaljeet Sandhu

Kamaljeet Sandhu is a former woman Indian athlete who won gold medal at 1970 Asian Games in 400 m race. She ran the distance in 57 seconds.

When did the Indian football team make its first appearance at Olympics?

a) 1936 b) 1948 c) 1952 d) 1956

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: b) 1948

The India national football team is governed by the All India Football Federation. Since 1948, the AIFF has been affiliated with FIFA, the international governing body for football.

When did India win its first Olympic hockey gold?

a) 1928 b) 1932 c) 1936 d) 1948

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: a) 1928

India national field hockey team was dominant in Olympic competition, winning eleven medals in twelve Olympics between 1928 and 1980.

Which among the following is associated with the name Kunjarani Devi?

a) Athletics b) Swimming c) Target shooting d) Weight lifting

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: d) Weight lifting

Her first World Women's Weightlifting Championship was the Manchester edition in 1989.

Who was the first Indian to reach the semi final in Wimbledon Tennis Championship?

a) Ananth Amritraj b) Premjit Lall c) Ramanathan Krishnan d) Ramesh Krishnan

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: c) Ramanathan Krishnan

Ramanathan Krishnan is a retired tennis player from India who was among the world's leading players in the 1950s and 1960s.

When did India reach the final of Davis cup for the first time?

a) 1964 b) 1966 c) 1970 d) 1974

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: d) 1974

The Davis Cup had only ever been won by the United States, Great Britain/British Isles, France and Australia/Australasia until 1973. South Africa and India qualified for the final in 1974. The final was scratched and South Africa was awarded the Davis Cup after India refused to travel to South Africa for the final in protest of the South African government's apartheid policies

How many times did Geet Sethi win the IBSF World Billiards title?

a) 2 b) 3 c) 4 d) 5

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: b) 3

Geet Siriram Sethi won the World Amateur Billiards title during 1985, 1987, and 2001.

Who was the first Indian to win the World Amateur Billiards title?

a) Geet Sethi b) Mike Russell c) Pankaj Adwani d) Wilson Jones

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: d) Wilson Jones

Wilson Lionel Garton-Jones was a professional player of English billiards from India. Jones won the amateur world championship twice, in 1958 and 1964.

When was Amateur Athletics Federation of India established?

a) 1936 b) 1946 c) 1956 d) 1966

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: b) 1946

Amateur Athletic Federation of India (AAFI) was formed at the initiative of Prof. G. Sondhi and Maharaja Yadvindra Singh.

Who among the following is not associated with billiards in India?

a) Ashok Shandilya b) Manoj Kothari c) Mihir Sen d) Subash Agarwal

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: c) Mihir Sen

Mihir Sen is best known for being the only man to earn the distinction of swimming the Oceans of the five continents in one calendar year (1966). This included the Palk Strait, Dardanelles, Bosphorpous, The straits of Gibraltar and the entire length of the Panama Canal.

A five-time All-Star selection, Miller led the league in free throw accuracy five times and won a gold medal in the 1996 Summer Olympics.

Which National Hockey League goaltender has the most career wins?

a) Andy Moog b) Glenn Anderson c) Grant Fuhr d) Jari Kurri

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: c) Grant Fuhr

Grant Scott Fuhr is a Canadian former ice hockey goaltender in the National Hockey League and former goaltending coach for the Phoenix Coyotes

Who won the 1993 "King of the Ring"?

a) Bret Hart b) Owen Hart c) Randy Savage d) Shawn Michaels

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: a) Bret Hart

Hart was the first man to win both the WWF and WCW Triple Crown Championships. He is the only two-time King of the Ring, winning the 1991 tournament and the first King of the Ring pay-per-view in 1993.

What was the name of the first World Cup trophy?

a) Jules Rimes trophy b) Rodolphe Seeldrayers trophy

c) Daniel Burley Woolfall trophy d) Arthur Drewry trophy

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: a) Jules Rimes trophy

Jules Rimes is considered as the creator of Football World Cup.

When was the Football Association established?

a) 1853 b) 1863 c) 1873 d) 1883

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: b) 1863

The Football Association was formed on October 26, 1863. The purpose of the organization was to formulate official football rules.

Against which country England played history's first international football fixture?

a) Belgium b) France c) Italy d) Scotland

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: d) Scotland

History's first international football fixture was played between Scotland and England on November 30, 1872 in Glasgow, Scotland.

Against which team Uruguay won the first World Cup final in 1930?

a) Argentina b) Brazil c) USA d) Yugoslavia

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: a) Argentina

The first World Cup final was played on July 30, 1930 at Centenario Stadium in Uruguay.

What was history's first official World Cup soccer ball called?

a) Azteca b) Jabulani c) Tango d) Telstar

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: d) Telstar

Telstar became the first official soccer ball of a World Cup in 1970. It has 32 black- and-white panels and has since become an icon of the game. It was manufactured by giant football brand Adidas and got its name from a communication satellite which has a similar geometry to it.

Which country won the first European football championship?

a) Soviet Union b) Spain c) West Germany d) Yugoslavia

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: a) Soviet Union

The Euro 1960 is the first European Nations Football Championship. The final tournament of 1960 was played in France and won after extra time by USSR over Yugoslavia in a 2-1 score.

Which football player was dubbed as "The Fifth Beatle"?

a) Bobby Charlton b) Bobby Moore c) Duncan Edwards d) George Best

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: d) George Best

George Best earned the nickname â€œThe Fifth Beatleâ€ in the mid-1960s. The tag was popularized by British press who saw him both as a sporting and style icon.

Where was the first World Cup Football held?

a) Brazil b) Canada c) France d) Uruguay

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: d) Uruguay

The world cup was first held in 1930.

a) Billiards b) Equestrian c) Golf d) Snooker

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: a) Billiards

Michael Ferreira is a three-time Amateur World champion.

When was the National Sports Festival for Women started?

a) 1970 b) 1974 c) 1975 d) 1976

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: c) 1975

This is organised by Sports Authority of India.

With which game is 'Caddy' associated?

a) Billiards b) Bridge c) Golf d) Snooker

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: c) Golf

At many amateur tournaments, players are required to walk and to carry their own bags, but at the professional and top amateur level, as well as at high-level private clubs, players may be accompanied by caddies, who carry and manage the

players' equipment and who are allowed by the rules to give advice on the play of the course. A caddy's advice can only be given to the player or players for whom the caddy is working, and not to other competing players.

Who became the first Indian to win a grand slam title?

a) Leander Peas b) Mahesh Bhupathi c) Both (a) and (b) d) None of the above

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: b) Mahesh Bhupathi

In 1997, he became the first Indian to win a Grand Slam tournament.

Which of the following is the highest award in sports in the world?

a) Arjuna Award b) Jesse Owens Award c) Olympic Order d) Dronacharya Award

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: c) Olympic Order

The Olympic Order was established in May 1975 by the International Olympic Committee as a successor to the Olympic Certificate.

What is the full form of IAAF?

a) International Amateur Athletics Federation b) Indian Amateur Athletics Federation

c) Indian Association of Athletics and Field events d) None of the above

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: a) International Amateur Athletics Federation

It was founded on 17 July 1912 by representatives from 17 national athletics federations.

Who was the first athlete to be awarded Padma Shri?

a) G. S. Randhawa b) Milkha Singh c) P. T. Usha d) V. S. Chauhan

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: b) Milkha Singh

In 1959, Milkha Singh was honoured with Padma Shri.

When were the first Commonwealth Games held?

a) 1930 b) 1949 c) 1952 d) 1957

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: a) 1930

The Commonwealth Games was known as the British Empire Games from 1930-1950.

In which year did the Commonwealth Games get the current title?

a) 1952 b) 1957 c) 1974 d) 1978

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: d) 1978

The Commonwealth Games was known as the British Empire and Commonwealth Games from 1954-1966 and British Commonwealth Games from 1970-1974.

In which category did India win its first Commonwealth medal?

a) Athletics b) Hockey c) Shooting d) Wrestling

View Answer / Hide Answer

ANSWER: d) Wrestling

India's first ever Commonwealth medal was won by Rashid Anwar who won a bronze in Welterweight category of Wrestling.

Who won the David Dixon Award at 2006 Melbourne Games?

a) Gagan Narang b) Ian Thorpe c) Leisal Jones d) Samaresh Jung

View Answer / Hide Answer
